issue.title: Typo?
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.0.204

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox, Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

example.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Hide your search queries

### Add your comment and screenshots

Typo? 
Easilist > EasyList ?

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/7ffbf3367a32a6e2717e8e20b229b38d31070612/EnglishFilter/sections/antiadblock.txt#L421

<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![resim](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/109770855/181397186-a640a1fa-dbc8-444a-ba6c-5ded029d6e59.png)

</details>

---

Typo 2


The rule seems to be wrong. has too many spaces

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/a65b13e20900c8c204c03d7eb9101b77209ca1c3/EnglishFilter/sections/foreign.txt#L4836

</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

![resim](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/109770855/181397224-de80b7c1-9610-4025-9c8a-715aeb7b56cd.png)


</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

New type of YouTube ads is blocked by our filters. If that does not help, try using our script by following the instructions below.

---

Please enable AdGuard Extra in AdGuard settings (for app users).

---

Browser extension users should install `AdGuard Extra` script into `Tampermonkey` extension.

https://userscripts.adtidy.org/beta/adguard-extra/1.0/adguard-extra.user.js

comment.body:
> 

I guess you were talking about the black screen before the video. It's a fix for old iOS devices and there is no other way to solve it, but if you have iOS 15, enable `advanced blocking` and check the filter update - you should be shown YouTube without ads in Safari.

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: tv.gab.com youtube-like ads
issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard Browser Extension

### AdGuard version

4.0.204

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://tv.gab.com/channel/ankush012/view/the-smoothie-diet-21-day-rapid-62dc1f90aa6babef2705749d

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Annoyances filter, EasyList, EasyPrivacy, Web Annoyances Ultralist

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. gab tv now has ads just like youtube, they keep showing up whether ublock origin is on or off.

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: Unchecking "Enabled on this site" does not disable the annoyances filters for the site
issue.body:
@piejanssens commented on [Tue Jun 07 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues/718)

<!--  As an open-source project with a dedicated but small maintainer team, it can sometimes take a long time for issues to be addressed so please be patient and we will get back to you as soon as we can.
-->

### Prerequisites

Please answer the following questions for yourself before submitting an issue. **YOU MAY DELETE THE PREREQUISITES SECTION.**

- [X] I am running the latest version
- [X] I checked the documentation and found no answer
- [X] I checked to make sure that this issue has not already been filed

### Issue Details

<!--- Please include all relevant details about the environment you experienced the bug in -->

* AdGuard for Safari version: 1.11.4
* Environment name and version: Safari 15.5 (17613.2.7.1.8)
* Operating System: macOS 12.4.0
* Filters you use in AdGuard: ads, privacy, annoyances (EasyList Cookie List, I don't care about cookies, AdBlock warning removal list), language-specific (NL)


### Expected Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. -->
If I uncheck "Enabled on this site", I expect any AdGuard to no longer affect the site in any way.

### Actual Behavior
<!-- A clear and concise description of what actually happened. -->
Some filters are still being applied. I am certain that this is a bug in AdGuard as I can get the wanted effect by disabling the AdGuard all-together via the "Pause AdGuard for Safari" option.

### Screenshots
<!-- If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. -->

<details><summary>Screenshot:</summary>

<!--- drag and drop, upload or paste your screenshot to this area-->

</details>

### Additional Information
<!-- Add any other context about the problem here. -->

---

@Birbber commented on [Wed Jun 08 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues/718#issuecomment-1150112013)

@piejanssens Hi! Could you give an example of the webpage so I could check it on my end?

---

@piejanssens commented on [Wed Jun 08 2022](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardForSafari/issues/718#issuecomment-1150120107)

Hi @Birbber,

1. Enable the "I don't care about cookies" annoyance filter.
2. Visit https://www.era.be/nl/te-koop
3. Notice you can't scroll
4. Disable AdGuard on the site
5. Notice you still can't scroll...
7. "Pause AdGuard for Safari"
8. Accept the cookies
9. Notice you can scroll

comment.body:
Another example: https://www.etsy.com/nl/market/dyson_attachments
Again, it's a cookie annoyance blocker that is breaking the page navigation (scrolling). Whitelisting the site does not sold-be it, disabling AdGuard altogether solves it. 

I have this issue both on desktop (macOS / Safari) as on mobile (iOS / Safari").
